desc:
See this copy in the KDA analysis text. There is a spelling mistake. 'Stimulu' should be Stimuli. 

Change this:

'Understand how each of the messages in your *Stimulu* drive Behaviour Change. Which messages have the strongest influence on achieving your campaign's objectives? Did any have a negative influence? Understanding this will allow you to optimise your *Stimulu* to ensure that the most important messages feature prominently.'

To this:

'Understand how each of the messages in your *Stimulus* drive Behaviour Change. Which messages have the strongest influence on achieving your campaign's objectives? Did any have a negative influence? Understanding this will allow you to optimise your *Stimulus* to ensure that the most important messages feature prominently.'
descHtml:
See this copy in the KDA analysis text. There is a spelling mistake. 'Stimulu' should be Stimuli.

Change this:

'Understand how each of the messages in your Stimulu drive Behaviour Change. Which messages have the strongest influence on achieving your campaign's objectives? Did any have a negative influence? Understanding this will allow you to optimise your Stimulu to ensure that the most important messages feature prominently.'

To this:

'Understand how each of the messages in your Stimulus drive Behaviour Change. Which messages have the strongest influence on achieving your campaign's objectives? Did any have a negative influence? Understanding this will allow you to optimise your Stimulus to ensure that the most important messages feature prominently.'
title: KDA- incorrect spelling in analysis text
subtitle: DS-592

desc:
Steps to replicate:

When looking at the brand recall score of this Lays Content test study (Quick Trip - Animatic):

[https://www.zappi.io/app/analysis/dynamic_content_test/explore/54476/stats/view/Crosstab/pages/7154121|https://www.zappi.io/app/analysis/dynamic_content_test/explore/54476/stats/view/Crosstab/pages/7154121]

The brand for this study was configured as "Lay's":

!image-2019-04-11-15-30-41-201.png|width=200,height=183!

 

We can see a recall score of 10%. 

However, when we export the raw data to csv, manual checks have found that the score should be around 63%. 

[https://reports.zappi.io/setup/surveys/86658|https://reports.zappi.io/setup/surveys/86658]

See workings attached. 

[^quick_trip_-_animatic_53145.csv]

 

UAC:

The brand recall score for the given study is around 63%.

title: Brand recall issue on DCT- lays example
subtitle: DS-593

desc:
As an Ad Pulse Customer, I would like the ability to filter the results by time, so that I can see how the results change at different points of the campaign.

A/C 1
Customer should be able to select both the start and end dates of time period in the filter. i.e. from week 2 \- week 4 of campaign.

A/C 2
The time period filter should apply to both the exposed and control group so that the calculated scores are based on given time period filter

A/C 3
The minimum value of time that can be used to set the time period filter should be a week and the maximum a month (where a month is defined as 30 days).

A/C 4

The “start” of the time period is defined by the date of the first respondent filling out the survey.
descHtml:
As an Ad Pulse Customer, I would like the ability to filter the results by time, so that I can see how the results change at different points of the campaign.

A/C 1
Customer should be able to select both the start and end dates of time period in the filter. i.e. from week 2 - week 4 of campaign.

A/C 2
The time period filter should apply to both the exposed and control group so that the calculated scores are based on given time period filter

A/C 3
The minimum value of time that can be used to set the time period filter should be a week and the maximum a month (where a month is defined as 30 days).

A/C 4

The “start” of the time period is defined by the date of the first respondent filling out the survey.
title: Add time filter to Ad Pulse chart
subtitle: ADPULSE-141

desc:
As a Zappi Ad pulse client, I would like to use macros for my Ad Pulse studies. Using macros is important for two reasons: 

*1) Easier and more frictionless project set up* Using macros will allow my ad ops team to use just *one* pixel for a project set up and still enable me to measure my campaign across multiple dimensions (creative, audience, platform) as per the macros I choose to append to the pixel. 

*2) More granular and versatile reporting* Ad Pulse studies that are measured using a macro-ed pixel will allow me to view campaign performance across multiple campaign dimensions (creative, audience, platform) easily and will provide me with a lot more insight than using non-macro-ed pixels.

A/C
Map out the steps required to test using macros on Ad Pulse and specify what information is needed to move forward with building out this capability.

Test will be done with AudienceX using a campaign that has ads served across multiple DSPs (Sizmek, Tremor, Adobe).
descHtml:
As a Zappi Ad pulse client, I would like to use macros for my Ad Pulse studies. Using macros is important for two reasons:

1) Easier and more frictionless project set up Using macros will allow my ad ops team to use just one pixel for a project set up and still enable me to measure my campaign across multiple dimensions (creative, audience, platform) as per the macros I choose to append to the pixel.

2) More granular and versatile reporting Ad Pulse studies that are measured using a macro-ed pixel will allow me to view campaign performance across multiple campaign dimensions (creative, audience, platform) easily and will provide me with a lot more insight than using non-macro-ed pixels.

A/C
Map out the steps required to test using macros on Ad Pulse and specify what information is needed to move forward with building out this capability.

Test will be done with AudienceX using a campaign that has ads served across multiple DSPs (Sizmek, Tremor, Adobe).
title: Use Macros for running Ad Pulse studies
subtitle: ADPULSE-163

desc:
The current implementation of getting logs from jobs inside of a deployment / backup / restore is sub-optimal, for 3 reasons:

# If a job fails, most of the time logs are not displayed (even if an attempt to fetch them is made)
# On failure, there may be another pod that is created to attempt to complete the job. This can cause issues with logging as we only fetch from one pod. e.g. 
{code:java}
Found 2 pods, using pod/data-collector-1-database-migrate-32661-lx42q
{code}
# Logs are only fetched after a job has completed (successfully or otherwise). Ideally we would want to tail the logs of the currently running pod for a job.
descHtml:
The current implementation of getting logs from jobs inside of a deployment / backup / restore is sub-optimal, for 3 reasons:

  1. If a job fails, most of the time logs are not displayed (even if an attempt to fetch them is made)
  2. On failure, there may be another pod that is created to attempt to complete the job. This can cause issues with logging as we only fetch from one pod. e.g. 
    Found 2 pods, using pod/data-collector-1-database-migrate-32661-lx42q
  3. Logs are only fetched after a job has completed (successfully or otherwise). Ideally we would want to tail the logs of the currently running pod for a job.
title: Improve Job Logging The current implementation of getting logs from jobs inside of
subtitle: DS-545

desc:
Product: Key Drivers analysis text

Report URL: Example: https://www.zappistore.com/app/zappi_product_test/explore?groupBySurvey=true&searchObject=%7B%22query%22%3A%7B%22query%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%2C%22filters%22%3A%7B%22bool%22%3A%7B%22must%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%7D%7D&sortingOptions=%7B%22key%22%3A%22created_at%22%2C%22label%22%3A%22Date%22%2C%22order%22%3A%22desc%22%7D

Description of error: We are missing a word in the analysis text where we give a quotation example.  We should probably pipe in the {{product}} or {{ad}} or {{concept}} tags like we do for the various products analysis text already so it stays consistent, i.e. you see {{product}} when looking at zappi product test, and {{concept}} when looking at zappi concept tests, etc.

Steps to Replicate: Navigate to the above url and access the statsapp page.  You will see we're missing a word there.

Expected result: It should include the correct word relative to the product/ad/concept/etc.

Requester: jack@zappistore.com

Severity: 3


      
      ~* Please see Zendesk Support tab for further comments and attachments.~

subtitle: DS-61

desc:
As a ZappiStore Team member, from any team 
I can see a series of charts
Hosted in IO/Fluid
Showing data which gives me insight into key internal metrics
This epic replaces RND-45

I can also combine and manipulate data
Using the 'Measures' feature in Fluid IO-465

This will include:

- Sales Data ZA-8

> Number of Projects
> Total Sales
> Partner Revenue 
> Zappi Revenue
> Revenue Mix
> Sales origin
> Sales Performance

- Development Team Velocity

> Time spent on Tasks [from status in Jira]
> Velocity (SP per sprint completed & missed, Issues per sprint completed & missed)
> ROI (time spent on projects vs. cost of a team) (edited)
> Focus
> Sprint % in focus
> Sprint completion
> Epic % complete
> Version % complete
> Ease of use & Clarity of Insight survey reporting per Product

- Support Data ZA-6

> Bugs open/closed over time
> Bugs open/closed by product
> Bugs open/closed per number studies launched
> Urgent/high/normal bugs proportion

- Product Metrics ZA-5

> Average Survey Time
> Average Fieldwork Duration
> Average Drop out rate
> Number of Self Serve/Number Manual
> Sales figures
> Customer Feedback Data

- Marketing ZA-4

- ZappiLife

> Slack Activity ZA-3
> GitHub data
> Lunch Data

+Potential sources of Data+
Salesforce
Jira
GitHub
Insight Out https://metrics.insight-out.com/
Google Analytics
Pardot
Slack https://api.slack.com/
City Pantry https://github.com/CityPantry

+Potential Visualisation Ideas+
Kibana: https://www.elastic.co/products/kibana

*Notes*
The high level need is for sandbox and prod environments for what is currently the "intellection.client".
We'll need the following cron jobs to run:
||Command||Time||Notes||
|rake jira:snapshot|01:00|Grab all data from Jira|
|rake zendesk:snapshot|01:30|Grab all data from Zendesk|
|rake insight_out:snapshot|02:00|Grab a list of surveys from IO|
descHtml:

  • Sales Data ARCHIVE-798 Done

> Epic % complete
> Version % complete
> Ease of use & Clarity of Insight survey reporting per Product

  • Support Data ARCHIVE-780 PBR

> Bugs open/closed over time
> Bugs open/closed by product
> Bugs open/closed per number studies launched
> Urgent/high/normal bugs proportion

  • Product Metrics ARCHIVE-802 READY FOR CLIENT APPROVAL

> Average Survey Time
> Average Fieldwork Duration
> Average Drop out rate
> Number of Self Serve/Number Manual
> Sales figures
> Customer Feedback Data

  • Marketing ARCHIVE-804 PBR
  • ZappiLife

> Slack Activity ARCHIVE-781 PBR
> GitHub data
> Lunch Data

Potential sources of Data
Salesforce
Jira
GitHub
Insight Out https://metrics.insight-out.com/
Google Analytics
Pardot

City Pantry https://github.com/CityPantry

Potential Visualisation Ideas

Notes
The high level need is for sandbox and prod environments for what is currently the "intellection.client".
We'll need the following cron jobs to run:

Command Time Notes
rake jira:snapshot 01:00 Grab all data from Jira
rake zendesk:snapshot 01:30 Grab all data from Zendesk
rake insight_out:snapshot 02:00 Grab a list of surveys from IO

desc:
As a Zappi User
When I select a set of measures
I expect to see Findings with those measure names in them
And not a default measure name, such as `Value` (see image below)

title: Findings should display the correct Measure
subtitle: IT-37

desc:
As a client,
I want to see non-stats based expertise,
So that I may see expert driven rules

*AC1*
Given I have selected a single concept
Given I have access to the spreadsheet with expert driven rules,
Then I can make them appear on Creative Video,
When they fire

*AC2*
Given I have selected a multiple concepts
Given I have access to the spreadsheet with expert driven rules,
Then I can make them appear on Creative Video,
When they fire
**** tech background

Basically, there are two handlers `finding` and `rules_opinion`. And for each column in the dataset, you make a finding. Then the set of findings go into the rules opinion and then it triggers the line in the spreadsheet, essentially.

There is a working example in MARC (https://github.com/Intellection/zappi.client/blob/insights_hackathon/modules/marc_rapid_results/marc_rapid_results_extension.rb#L737)
(https://github.com/Intellection/zappi.client/blob/insights_hackathon/modules/marc_rapid_results/analysis_models/compound_norms_comparison_new.rb)

Please see and use `insights_hackathon` branch of zappi

Can we just use the second page for now, and make a CSV of that.
Ignore the first two text columns. 

The findings use the one sample to-test (i.e. the coloured parts) and the last column is the rules opinion based off of those two findings.
descHtml:
As a client,
I want to see non-stats based expertise,
So that I may see expert driven rules

AC1
Given I have selected a single concept
Given I have access to the spreadsheet with expert driven rules,
Then I can make them appear on Creative Video,
When they fire

AC2
Given I have selected a multiple concepts
Given I have access to the spreadsheet with expert driven rules,
Then I can make them appear on Creative Video,
When they fire

        • tech background

Basically, there are two handlers `finding` and `rules_opinion`. And for each column in the dataset, you make a finding. Then the set of findings go into the rules opinion and then it triggers the line in the spreadsheet, essentially.

There is a working example in MARC (https://github.com/Intellection/zappi.client/blob/insights_hackathon/modules/marc_rapid_results/marc_rapid_results_extension.rb#L737)
(https://github.com/Intellection/zappi.client/blob/insights_hackathon/modules/marc_rapid_results/analysis_models/compound_norms_comparison_new.rb)

Please see and use `insights_hackathon` branch of zappi

Can we just use the second page for now, and make a CSV of that.
Ignore the first two text columns.

The findings use the one sample to-test (i.e. the coloured parts) and the last column is the rules opinion based off of those two findings.
title: Creative Video Expertise Rules
subtitle: DS-93
